alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 09 at 3:58PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Runoff from heavy rainfall overnight continues to impact the region causing elevated streamflows. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Susitna Valley. This includes the cities of Talkeetna And Willow. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Light to moderate rain has fallen overnight in the Talkeetna Mountains through Friday afternoon. Two day rain totals were between 1.5 to 2 inches along the Parks Highway and east into the Talkeetna Mountains. Light to moderate rain is expected to continue overnight with an additional 1 to 2 inches through Saturday morning. This rain has resulted in significant rises in small streams draining the Talkeetna Mountains. As of 2 pm Friday afternoon Willow Creek at the Parks Highway was at 9.7 ft and above action stage. Willow Creek at the Parks Highway is expected to crest this evening below minor flood stage. The Talkeetna River, Kashwitna River and Little Susitna River have all risen rapidly and are currently forecast to crest below flood stage Friday night into Saturday. As of Friday afternoon there have been no reports of flooding in the area. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Please do not drive through flooded areas, turn around, don`t drown.
